intro: Eisocreochiton, commonly known as the green sea slug, is a species of opisthobranch mollusk belonging to the family Aeolidiidae. It is characterized by its translucent, gelatinous body and a distinctive green coloration due to the presence of chloroplasts from the algae it consumes. The creature lacks a shell and possesses a muscular foot used for locomotion and feeding. Eisocreochiton is often found in shallow marine environments, where it feeds on sponges and other small organisms. Its unique biology makes it an important subject in studies of marine ecology and symbiotic relationships.
